source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_038_chunk6
evidence_span: Pressurized water reactor type fuel rods are being irradiated under postulated accident conditions in the Power Burst Facility at the Idaho National Engineering Laboratory as part of the Thermal Fuels Behavior Program. In these tests, film boiling was achieved by establishing a mismatch reactor power and coolant flow, while maintaining the coolant pressure at $1 5 \mathrm { { \bf M P a } }$ .

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_038_chunk6
evidence_span: Cladding embrittlement resulting from film boiling operation of intact fuel rods was found to be consistent with previously established embrittlement criteria based on oxygen content in $\beta$ -Zircaloy

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_038_chunk6
evidence_span: Rods that were operated with breached cladding were embrittled to a greater degree than intact fuel rods under similar oxidizing conditions.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_038_chunk6
evidence_span: This embrittlement appears to be associated with rim $\pmb { \alpha }$ and acicular $\pmb { \alpha }$ precipitation within the transformed $\beta$ field as well as with enhanced hydrogen absorption.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_038_chunk6
evidence_span: KEY wORDS: zirconium, cladding, embrittlement, oxidation, hydrogen, irradiation, zirconium alloys, fuel rods

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_038_chunk6
evidence_span: In-pile fuel behavior experiments have been performed to characterize the behavior of Zircaloy-4-clad, pressurized water reactor type fuel rods under film boiling operation produced by power-cooling-mismatch (PCM) conditions [1-6].
